meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules.
meanings.sent1: The fussbudgets in the office always insist on everything being perfectly organized.
meanings.sent2: The fussbudgets at the meeting spent hours debating the font size on the presentation slides.
meanings.sent3: The fussbudgets at the picnic made sure every sandwich was cut into equal halves.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a jungle of fussbudgets, each item meticulously placed in its designated spot.
meanings.sent5: The fussbudgets in the library shushed anyone who dared to make a sound.

meanings.definition: Plural form of fussbudget: a group of individuals who are overly fussy or particular.
meanings.sent1: The fussbudgets gathered around the table, each with their own set of strict preferences.
meanings.sent2: The fussbudgets in the neighborhood always complained about the noise levels.
meanings.sent3: The fussbudgets in the family insisted on following a strict schedule for every holiday.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a paradise for fussbudgets, with each flower meticulously arranged in rows.
meanings.sent5: The fussbudgets in the classroom always corrected others' grammar mistakes.
